Authors:
Luís Adriano Funez, Marcela Monteiro, Diogo Henrique
Costa-Rezende, Genivaldo Alves-Silva, Ricardo Drechsler-Santos
Title:
Rickenella fibula (Repetobasidiaceae: Basidiomycota): a tiny
species with large distribution also occurs in Brazil
Keywords:
Atlantic Forest, Funga, Hymenochaetales,
Repetobasidiaceae, Rickenella clade
Abstract:
During a survey of macrofungi in Santa Catarina state,
Brazil, some specimens of bryophilous fungi were collected. The
specimens were identified as Rickenella fibula, representing the first
record of the species for Brazilian Atlantic Forest. The species is
characterized by bright orange basidiomes, pileus 35 mm diam, 1320
lamellae and 12 lamellulae between two lamellae, basidiospores
ellipsoid, 4.87.2 × 2.03.3 μm and cystidia 36.551.1 × 5.28.4 μm. A
morphological description, macro and microscopic photographs, as well as
a distribution map of this species in South America and phylogenetic
discussion are provided.
